summary: This batch file lets you clean up your HighResTexturePacks, and removes all buggy and unused junk files.
descriptionHtml:
[size=\"3\"][color=red]This file is outdated and no longer supported. I don\'t play Skyrim anymore. Go here to find a newer version: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=14719]HighResTexturePack DLC Tweaks[/url].
Full rights to everything is given to my real life friend Eiwyn.[/size][/color]


This is a small command file that lets you clean up Bethesdas HighResTexturePack, using files from the excellent [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=8236]HD Textures DLC Fix[/url]. After cleaning, you do not need any extra BSA or loose files to fix the problems with HighResTexturePack01.bsa and HighResTexturePack02.bsa. They will contain only replacement files for Skyrim - Textures.bsa and nothing else.


1. Download [color=cyan]HD Texture DLC Fix v1.3b Loose Files[/color] from [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=8236]HD Textures DLC Fix[/url] and extract the archive to a new folder.
2. Use [url=http://fallout3.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=34]FO3 Archive Utility[/url] to extract your [color=cyan]HighResTexturePack01.bsa[/color] to a new folder.
3. Extract your [color=cyan]HighResTexturePack02.bsa[/color] to another folder.
4. Download and extract my batch file.
5. Edit my batch file and change the first 3 lines so that they match your paths.
6. Run the batchfile. I have added annoyingly many pauses so that you can watch and verify that everything works.
7. Use [url=http://fallout3.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=34]FO3 Archive Utility[/url] to rebuild your new BSAs.


The first 3 lines in [color=cyan]Clean_HighResTexturePack_DLC_Fix.cmd[/color] might seem confusing. I use a ramdisk F: with a folder \\bsa as working area. When I extract archives (bsa or 7z) I name the folders same as the archive. This is why the first 3 lines looks like this:

[code]subst m: \"f:\\bsa\\HighResTexturePack01\\textures\"
subst n: \"f:\\bsa\\HighResTexturePack02\\textures\"
subst o: \"f:\\bsa\\HD_Texture_DLC_Fix_v1_3b_Loose_Files-8236\\textures\"[/code]

You may of course extract your archives to any folder, but you have to paste in the full paths, ending with [b]\\textures[/b]

[code]subst m: \"<your path for extracted HighResTexturePack01.bsa goes here>\\textures\"
subst n: \"<your path for extracted HighResTexturePack02.bsa goes here>\\textures\"
subst o: \"<your path for extracted HD_Texture_DLC_Fix_v1_3b_Loose_Files-8236.7z goes here>\\textures\"[/code]

If you extract to desktop, then your paths might be something like this:

[code]subst m: \"C:\\Users\\Name\\Desktop\\HighResTexturePack01\\textures\"
subst n: \"C:\\Users\\Name\\Desktop\\HighResTexturePack02\\textures\"
subst o: \"C:\\Users\\Name\\Desktop\\HD_Texture_DLC_Fix_v1_3b_Loose_Files-8236\\textures\"[/code]



For more info about the BSAs, see this fine thread by Brumbek:
http://forums.bethsoft.com/topic/1343691-info-detailed-analysis-of-highres-pack-click-to-learn/
author: PatrikBeson
